articles.title: One person still missing and four in critical condition after Paris explosion
articles.description: Investigators are still working to determine to cause of the blast, which injured more than 30 people on Wednesday in the French capital's fifth district.
articles.content:
Rescue workers are still searching for a missing person after a massive explosion injured more than 30 people and levelled a building on Paris's Left Bank.

articles.title: Church of England to divest from fossil fuel companies
articles.description: None of the oil and gas majors the Church was investing in have aligned themselves with the Paris Agreement, it said.
articles.content:
T he Church of England is pulling its investment from fossil fuel companies because they are failing to align with the Paris Agreement, the Archbishop of Canterbury has said.

articles.title: Six people in critical condition, one still missing after Paris blast - prosecutor
articles.description: Six people remained in a critical condition and one person was believed still missing on Thursday, one day after a blast ripped through a street near Paris' historic Latin Quarter, the city's public prosecution office said.
articles.content:

articles.title: 'First-ever' military-civilian MALE drone unveiled in Paris
articles.description: Elbit Systems once again stole the Paris Air Show by showcasing its dual military- and civilian-use Hermes 900 "Starliner" drone.
articles.content: Israeli defense giant Elbit Systems showcased its Hermes 900 "Starliner" drone at this year's Paris Air Show. A specially designed large medium-range long endurance (MALE) drone, the Hermes 900 is Elbit's civilian offering of its highly successful un... [772 chars]

articles.title: Ukrainian athletes should have chance to qualify for Paris Games-IOC
articles.description: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) on Thursday appealed to Ukraine to give their athletes the chance to qualify for the Paris 2024 Olympics despite a partial ban on competing against Russian and Belarusian athletes.

articles.title: Explosion in Paris injures at least 24 people, police look at gas leak as possible cause
articles.description: Police say a strong explosion has hit a building in Paris’ Left Bank, leaving at least 24 people injured.
articles.content: A strong explosion rocked a building in Paris' Left Bank on Wednesday, injuring at least 24 people, igniting a fire that sent smoke soaring over the French capital's monuments and prompting an evacuation of other properties, authorities said. Police ... [4358 chars]
